item.title: L1, L2 norms and regularized linear models
item.description: Bias and variance The bias-variance tradeoff describes the problem in balancing the two types of errors in supervised learning models.

item.title: Visualizing the gradient descent in R
item.description: The general idea of the gradient descent is to iteratively tweak parameters with the goal of minimizing a loss function.

item.title: ANOVA and linear regression: same but different
item.description: I preface this post with a bit of a digression.

item.title: Understanding PCA
item.description: Pricinpal component analysis (PCA) is often used as a means of exploratory analysis to uncover relatedness in a data set.
